de.hs_duesseldorf.medien.mi.httphsdronelog.hsdronelog.network.util

Class NetworkCharsetConverterReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • java.io.FilterReader
        • de.hs_duesseldorf.medien.mi.httphsdronelog.hsdronelog.network.util.NetworkCharsetConverterReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Readable

    public class NetworkCharsetConverterReader
extends FilterReader
    The NetworkCharsetConverterReader class is a filter for character streams. It converts encoded escape characters read from the stream to its decoded character.

    • Field Detail

      • m_charBuffer

        private Integer[] m_charBuffer
        A buffer to save characters read. For escape character detection you have to read more than one character at the same time. The characters are saved in case that there was no escape char.

      • m_bufferPointer

        private int m_bufferPointer
        The current index for the m_charBuffer. This pointer points onto the current buffer position so you can get all characters placed in the buffer in the right order.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetworkCharsetConverterReader

        public NetworkCharsetConverterReader(Reader in)
        Creates a new NetworkCharsetConverterReader instance. Use this instance to convert encoded escape chars to decoded escape chars.
        Parameters:
        in - Reader object providing the underlying stream.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read()
         throws IOException
        Reads a single character. Converts escape characters into a charset the app can handle.
        Overrides:
        read in class FilterReader
        Returns:
        The character read, as an integer in the range 0 to 65535 (0x00-0xffff), or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • read

        public int read(char[] cbuf,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws IOException
        Reads characters into a portion of an array. Converts escape characters into a charset the app can handle.
        Overrides:
        read in class FilterReader
        Parameters:
        cbuf - Destination buffer
        off - Offset at which to start storing characters
        len - Maximum number of characters to read
        Returns:
        The number of characters read, or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • nextValueFromReader

        private int nextValueFromReader()
                         throws IOException
        Reads the next char from the in Reader. If the coming char sequence is a unicode encoded char, then it reads the whole char sequence and converts it into the decoded char. To detect an unicode encoded char more than one char has to be read to check the signal char sequence "\\u". So if a '\\' is read then the m_charBuffer will be filled with the next characters.
        Returns:
        The next character to be returned
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/o Exception occurs

      • fillUnicodeValuesIntoBuffer

        private void fillUnicodeValuesIntoBuffer()
                                  throws IOException
        Gets the values for a unicode encoded char. So the method will read the next 4 chars from in saves them in indexes 2 - 5
        Throws:
        IOException - If the end of stream is reached and less than 4 chars were read.

      • fillSignalCharsIntoBuffer

        private void fillSignalCharsIntoBuffer(int firstValue)
                                throws IOException
        Fills the m_charBuffer with the next two characters.
        Parameters:
        firstValue - The character read already to add.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O Exception occures.

      • nextValueFromBuffer

        private int nextValueFromBuffer()
        Gets the next value from the buffer to be returned
        Returns:
        The next value from the buffer.

      • clearBuffer

        private void clearBuffer()
        Clears the m_charBuffer. The values are set to null.

      • isUnicode

        private boolean isUnicode()
        Checks if the current values in the buffer are a unicode formatted char.
        Returns:
        true if the current first two chars indicates a unicode encoded char.

      • isEscapeChar

        private boolean isEscapeChar()
        Checks if the first two chars read are an escape char (char pairs like \/ or \\)
        Returns:
        true if the chars are a escape char
